title: AAQ: Why Did My Initial Attraction to Krishna Fade Over Time? | His Grace Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.text: Tanya Cushman Reviewer Reviewer's Name
Initially, I used to be so much attached to Krishna.
I used to cry most of the time because of separation from Radha Krishna.
But as I am doing this devotional service, I lost that emotional rasa.
How do I understand this?
Is it good to lose the emotional attachment towards Krishna?
Okay, see Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, Krishna himself, when he appeared 500 years ago.
He, although Krishna himself, he came in the role of a devotee.
He wanted to, Krishna wanted to personally set an example of how a devotee has to render devotional service to Krishna.
How to execute Bhakti Yoga.
Krishna wanted to teach the living entities by his personal example.
Just like when we go to school, the teacher will take a chalk and write on the board, write A like this.
B like this.
C like this.
So the teacher knows much more than A, B, C, D.
But she takes the role of somebody who is learning how to write alphabets.
So that the children can learn how to write A, B, C, D.
So in a similar way, Krishna explained in the Bhagavad Gita that rendering Bhakti Yoga is the topmost yoga system.
In the sixth chapter of the Bhagavad Gita, Krishna said,
One who renders Bhakti Yoga amongst all the yogis, he is the topmost.
So Krishna is established in the Bhagavad Gita that Bhakti Yoga is the topmost yoga system.
But now, how to execute that Bhakti Yoga?
So to teach that, Krishna came down as Chaitanya Mahaprabhu.
And by his personal example, he taught how to execute Bhakti Yoga.
So, Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, although by his personal behavior and example, he set the example of how a devotee should execute his devotion service to Krishna.
Chaitanya Mahaprabhu himself did not write much literature, philosophy.
He left it to his disciples, the Shad Goswamis, especially Rupa Goswami and Sanatana Goswami.
They wrote extensively about the philosophy of Bhakti Yoga.
But Chaitanya Mahaprabhu himself, if you see, he left behind only the Six Ashtaka, eight verses which he composed himself.
In this Six Ashtaka, eight verses, one of the things that Chaitanya Mahaprabhu prays is that when will that day come when I chant Krishna's name and torrents of tears will flow down my eyes.
And when I chant Krishna's name, my whole body will tremble out of great ecstasy.
So, this is what Chaitanya Mahaprabhu wrote.
This is the aspiration that every Bhakti Yogi should have.
When I chant Krishna's holy name, when I chant Hare Krishna Mahamantra, tears should flow from my eyes.
My voice should get choked up.
My body, my hands, legs should all be trembling in great ecstasy.
That's the aspiration of every practitioner of Bhakti Yoga.
So, naturally,
the devotee who has written here,
when in the beginning, when he started Krishna consciousness, when he started chanting,
he used to cry out of separation from Radha Krishna.
But slowly, that emotion has disappeared.
What went wrong?
Looks like I was better off before I started chanting Hare Krishna.
Well, fact is,
those feelings of separation from Radha and Krishna,
by which when we chant Hare Krishna,
our throat will get choked up, tears will flow from our eyes,
and these kind of emotions, these kind of bhava,
which come in our heart,
are on the transcendental platform.
They are not on the material platform.
As long as in our heart,
there is lust and there is greed,
there is desire to enjoy in the material world,
there is attraction to the opposite sex,
there is a great desire to become famous,
to be honored by others,
to be respected by others,
as long as these things are in the heart,
as long as kama, krodha, lobha, mada, moha, matsarya,
these things rule our heart,
as long as there is a greed in our heart,
to become wealthy,
I should get a good job,
I should start a good business,
I should become a good entrepreneur,
I should have a unicorn from my startup,
or I should get a job,
I should go abroad,
I should earn a lot of money,
as long as these things rule our heart,
you cannot experience those transcendental emotions of bhava bhakti.
Real feelings of separation from Krishna
will not take root within the heart.
Initially, some people may experience such things,
but these are not permanent emotions,
these are some temporary feelings
that one may develop at the beginning of Krishna consciousness,
out of some emotion, out of some sentiment.
But real feelings, real love for Krishna
comes when we have overcome
all these six enemies
which are ruling our heart,
kama, krodha, lobha, mada, moha and matsarya.
And we have come out of the bodily concept of life.
Have we really come out of the bodily concept of life?
That's the question we should ask ourselves.
Have I realized I am not the body,
I am a spirit soul, I am atma?
Have I realized I am not the body,
have I come out of this conception
that I am this body,
I am a man, I am a woman,
I am an Indian, I am an American,
I am a Christian, I am a Muslim, I am a Hindu?
Have we come out of all these things?
Until one comes out of the bodily concept of life,
there is no question of experiencing
real bhava bhakti,
real transcendental emotions for Krishna cannot take place.
So, we don't have to be concerned
that initially I was, you know,
I used to cry in separation from Radha Krishna,
but now those feelings are not there.
We don't have to worry.
All such feelings are on the material platform,
are on a sentimental platform.
You go on practicing Krishna consciousness,
gradually you will come out of the bodily concept of life.
First you will, in your heart,
what will develop is vairagya,
detachment from all the material,
material desires.
Then comes freedom from greed.
Then comes freedom from lust.
Then you will come out of the bodily concept of life.
And then further you have to progress,
you have to become firmly fixed up
in your devotional life.
You have to follow the principles of vaidhi bhakti,
rules and regulations of bhakti, vaidhi bhakti.
And when you become firmly fixed up
in following those rules,
rules and regulations of bhakti,
what will happen?
You will develop ruchi,
you will develop taste for that.
You will experience a certain kind of happiness
in executing practical devotional service.
If I have to wipe the floor of the temple hall,
I have to sweep the temple hall,
I have to render some practical devotional service like this,
I will develop a taste for it.
It will become greatly pleasurable for me.
Nobody has to tell me as a rule,
you have to follow the four regulated principles,
you have to fast on ekadashi,
you have to fast on janmashtami.
You will be waiting for that opportunity.
So, you have to come to that point of taste.
And when further you develop that taste,
then slowly it will transform into bhava bhakti.
Real transcendental emotions,
those feelings of separation from Radha and Krishna
will start manifesting.
And when that happens,
Whenever we chant Krishna's name,
currents of tears will flow down our eyes
like it's pouring rain.
And we will, you know,
our voice will get choked up
and all those emotions
will come.
So, there is a time and place for that.
That's a very advanced stage.
And we have to first undergo
purification at the lower stages
to be able to come to that.
So, we don't have to worry about this
temporary emotions
which we used to experience,
but they are no more there.
So, first we have to
become practically strong
and established on the platform
that I am not the body, I am spirit soul.
That comes first.
Then other things will follow.
So, simple thing,
continue executing your devotional service,
continue chanting Hare Krishna,
following the regulative principles,
reading Prabhupada's books,
gradually those transcendental real emotions
will manifest.
And once they manifest,
they will never go away.
That's the truth.
